explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning techniques to diagnose osteoporosis risk.
explanations.supervised learning: The study employs supervised learning methods such as logistic regression, decision trees, and support vector machines for classification tasks.
explanations.classification: The research focuses on classifying individuals based on their risk of osteoporosis using various machine learning algorithms.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper mentions the use of support vector classifiers (SVC) as one of the machine learning methods evaluated.
explanations.SVM: SVM is another term for support vector machine, which is used in the study.
explanations.decision tree: Decision tree classifiers (DT) are one of the machine learning methods applied in the research.
explanations.random forest: Random forest classifiers (RF) are mentioned as one of the methods used to assess osteoporosis risk.
explanations.logistic regression: Logistic regression (LR) is listed as one of the machine learning techniques employed in the study.
explanations.gradient boosting: Extreme gradient boosting (XGB) is highlighted as the best-performing model in the research.
